description: Variation of condition 2 (approved plans) of planning permission Ref:PP/2014/1513 dated 27/02/15 for part excavation and alterations to the existing basement to provide a 1 bedroom self-contained flat, the provision of lightwells at basement level to the rear and side elevations with metal balustrades, provision of basement window and doorway openings including bay window on the side elevation the provision of staircase access, alterations to the existing access gate in the front boundary wall, landscaping and refuse storage. Alterations to materials, increased height of sash window and removal of planter on top of the wall to the south east elevation.
decision_conditions: The proposed variation of condition (2), by reason of the design, materials proposed and removal of vegetation, would result in a unsympathetic form of development which would erode the character of the Locally Listed Building. Furthermore, the erosion of the character of a prominent Locally listed Building within the Hanwell Village Conservation Area would adversely impact the character of the Conservation Area.  The proposal is therefore contrary to the National Planning Policy Framework (2012); Policies 7.4, 7.6 and 7.8 of the London Plan (2015); Policies LV 7.4, 7B and 7C of the Ealing Development DPD 2013 and the Hanwell Village Conservation Area Management Plan 2008.
